title: GLM Regression with Oblivious Corruptions. (arXiv:2309.11657v1 [cs.DS])
abstract:
We demonstrate the first algorithms for the problem of regression for generalized linear models (GLMs) in the presence of additive oblivious noise. We assume we have sample access to examples $(x, y)$ where $y$ is a noisy measurement of $g(w^* \cdot x)$. In particular, 
ew{the noisy labels are of the form} $y = g(w^* \cdot x) + \xi + \epsilon$, where $\xi$ is the oblivious noise drawn independently of $x$ 
ew{and satisfies} $\Pr[\xi = 0] \geq o(1)$, and $\epsilon \sim \mathcal N(0, \sigma^2)$. Our goal is to accurately recover a 
ew{parameter vector $w$ such that the} function $g(w \cdot x)$ 
ew{has} arbitrarily small error when compared to the true values $g(w^* \cdot x)$, rather than the noisy measurements $y$.  We present an algorithm that tackles 
ew{this} problem in its most general distribution-independent setting, where the solution may not 
ew{even} be identifiable. 
ew{Our} algorithm returns 
ew{an accurate estimate of} the solution if it is identifiable, and otherwise

translated_title: GLM回归与无意识数据损坏

tldr: 这篇论文介绍了第一个在广义线性模型回归问题中处理加法无意识噪声的算法。算法的目标是通过样本访问来准确地恢复参数向量，使得模型的预测与真实值的误差尽可能小。
en_tdlr: This paper presents the first algorithm to handle additive oblivious noise in regression for generalized linear models (GLMs). The goal of the algorithm is to accurately recover the parameter vector in order to minimize the error between model predictions and true values.
